reviewText: 5 stars 'cause it's a great Saturday afternoon, I got the blues, nothin' else to do, kind of day. Total chick flick - which is a good thing! Get the chips and ice-cream, sit back and unwind with this movie.

This is a must see. Love It. Thanks Amazon.

I like this movie a lot because it is a very touching love story and I watch it a lot and also Michael Nouri and Cheryl Ladd are also one of my most favorite actors and I like their character roles. I am sad that Marie Dupret needs a heart transplant, also I am glad Peter Hallam has fire Mrs. Haun she was not a housekeeper in the movie. Raquel was the housekeeper and she resepcts every one including Melanie and her twin daughters who she looks up to and like a mother figure to them. I can't believe Mark and Val had sex if they knew they were going to be a family and also went to an abortion clinic to get an abortion with an unexperienced doctor who does not know what he or she is doing. I am glad Pam has given Melanie a chance and Melanie given birth to twins again and moved into a huge house.

This was a girl story, let's face it. Rich widowed doctor meets successful tv personality and they fall in love and get married despite all the difficulties their different lives caused them to bear. It was an excellent DVD and have watched it more than once.
DVD in perfect condition. Have watched it many times and no problems. What can you say about a movie. The dvd is in great condition and the vendor ships very fast. I recommend both highly.

I just watched this movie last night and thoroughly enjoyed it. That being said, My review is based on the menu & pause play shortcomings.

I paused the movie for ten minutes and came back. When I tried to resume play nothing happened (I should be able to pause a DVD and resume play without any trouble). I had to eject the disk and restart the movie. That is when I discovered THIS DVD DOESN'T HAVE SCENE SELECTION! The only option is to play the movie (from the beginning) and skip chapters to find where you left off. I can't believe anyone would produce a DVD without scene/chapter selections. Even the cheapest DVD's have them. If this very basic feature is important to you, I would wait until this DVD is rereleased with a proper menu.

The quick delivery of the DVD was excellent. Also the quality of the DVD is great and you enjoy whatching it. The sounds and theme song is very familiy like and there is so much to learn for a teenager about change
I have always loved this book made into a movie.  Danielle Steel's work  is a classic in all forms

If you have read Danielle Steel's books, you will recognise the style which is perfectly translated onto the screen - Michael Nouri and Cheryl Ladd are well cast together in this film about the trials and tribulations of merging two existing families into one, whilst also merging two people in love, but with demanding careers.  The film is well crafted, and if you have not seen any of the other films of DS books, will definitely leave you wanting to see the others as well.

I'm not a Danielle Steel fan i would rather watch some of the book's turn TV movies ....CHANGES was a good movie i was hook on it its like the brady bunch 20 yrs later in a way with a little more romance..the ending was just sweet for me i'm a sucker for romantic endings....

I caught this movie on the WE channel at midnight.  It was a tear-jerking and at times annoying movie. I didn't care so much for the quick resolution of everyone making up, however, the twins at the end was an interesting touch. Typical Danielle Steel based movie. I've seen others.

I love this movie. Watched it as a child with my mom. Lifetime movies are the best. I forgot the name of this movie and for years tried figuring it out and when I did I went nuts looking for it. Thank God for Amazon and it's sellers. Brought me back a piece of my childhood. When things were simple and though we had little money than,  Lifetime movies kept us happy and entertained. So many great memories.
